basic.description:
This course focuses on the methods used to collect, assess, and evaluate industrial relations related qualitative and quantitative data and information in a variety of contexts. Example topics covered include designing and administering workforce surveys (including interviews
and focus groups), compiling, analyzing, and presenting organizational data, and analyzing labour market survey data. 1.5 credit hours. Restriction: Open only to students who have attained a minimum `A-` grade in MIR-893.
basic.subject: MIR
basic.title: Analytical Methods for HR MIIR

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite for MIR 895 requires A- in MIR 893
